alertDefinitions.name: hbase_master_cpu
alertDefinitions.label: HBase Master CPU Utilization
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if CPU utilization of the HBase Master exceeds certain warning and critical thresholds. It checks the HBase Master JMX Servlet for the SystemCPULoad property. The threshold values are in percent.

alertDefinitions.name: hbase_regionserver_process_percent
alertDefinitions.label: Percent RegionServers Available
alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the configured percentage of RegionServer processes cannot be determined to be up and listening on the network for the configured warning and critical thresholds. It aggregates the results of RegionServer process down checks.

alertDefinitions.name: yarn_nodemanager_webui_percent
alertDefinitions.label: Percent NodeManagers Available
alertDefinitions.description: This alert is triggered if the number of down NodeManagers in the cluster is greater than the configured critical threshold. It aggregates the results of NodeManager process checks.

alertDefinitions.name: yarn_resourcemanager_webui
alertDefinitions.label: ResourceManager Web UI
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the ResourceManager Web UI is unreachable.

alertDefinitions.name: yarn_resourcemanager_cpu
alertDefinitions.label: ResourceManager CPU Utilization
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if CPU utilization of the ResourceManager exceeds certain warning and critical thresholds. It checks the ResourceManager JMX Servlet for the SystemCPULoad property. The threshold values are in percent.

alertDefinitions.name: yarn_resourcemanager_rpc_latency
alertDefinitions.label: ResourceManager RPC Latency

warning.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

ok.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

critical.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the ResourceManager operations RPC latency exceeds the configured critical threshold. Typically an increase in the RPC processing time increases the RPC queue length, causing the average queue wait time to increase for ResourceManager operations. The threshold values are in milliseconds.

alertDefinitions.name: nodemanager_health_summary
alertDefinitions.label: NodeManager Health Summary

parameters.name: connection.timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time before this alert is considered to be CRITICAL

alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if there are unhealthy NodeManagers

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_cpu
alertDefinitions.label: NameNode Host CPU Utilization
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if CPU utilization of the NameNode exceeds certain warning and critical thresholds. It checks the NameNode JMX Servlet for the SystemCPULoad property. The threshold values are in percent.

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_hdfs_pending_deletion_blocks
alertDefinitions.label: HDFS Pending Deletion Blocks
alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the number of blocks pending deletion in HDFS exceeds the configured warning and critical thresholds. It checks the NameNode JMX Servlet for the PendingDeletionBlock property.

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_client_rpc_queue_latency_daily
alertDefinitions.label: NameNode Client RPC Queue Latency (Daily)

parameters.display_name: Whether active and stanby NameNodes metrics should be merged
parameters.name: mergeHaMetrics
parameters.description: Whether active and stanby NameNodes metrics should be merged.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Time interval in minutes.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The application id used to retrieve the metric.

parameters.name: metricName
parameters.description: The metric to monitor.

parameters.name: metric.deviation.warning.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of RPC queue latency growth.

parameters.name: metric.deviation.critical.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of RPC queue latency growth.

parameters.name: minimumValue
parameters.description: The minimum latency to measure growth.

parameters.name: metric.units
parameters.description: The units that the metric data points are reported in.

alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the deviation of RPC latency on client port has grown beyond the specified threshold within a day period.

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_ha_health
alertDefinitions.label: NameNode High Availability Health

parameters.name: connection.timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time before this alert is considered to be CRITICAL

alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if either the Active NameNode or Standby NameNode are not running.

alertDefinitions.name: datanode_health_summary
alertDefinitions.label: DataNode Health Summary
alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if there are unhealthy DataNodes

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_directory_status
alertDefinitions.label: NameNode Directory Status

jmx.value:
calculate(args)
def calculate(args):
  import json
  json_statuses = json.loads({0})
  return len(json_statuses['failed']) if 'failed' in json_statuses else 0

alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the NameNode NameDirStatuses metric (name=NameNodeInfo/NameDirStatuses) reports a failed directory. The threshold values are in the number of directories that are not healthy.

alertDefinitions.name: datanode_process_percent
alertDefinitions.label: Percent DataNodes Available
alertDefinitions.description: This alert is triggered if the number of down DataNodes in the cluster is greater than the configured critical threshold. It aggregates the results of DataNode process checks.

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_hdfs_capacity_utilization
alertDefinitions.label: HDFS Capacity Utilization
alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert is triggered if the HDFS capacity utilization exceeds the configured warning and critical thresholds. It checks the NameNode JMX Servlet for the CapacityUsed and CapacityRemaining properties. The threshold values are in percent.

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_rpc_latency
alertDefinitions.label: NameNode RPC Latency

warning.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

ok.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

critical.text: Average Queue Time:[{0}], Average Processing Time:[{1}]

alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the NameNode RPC latency exceeds the configured critical threshold. Typically an increase in the RPC processing time increases the RPC queue length, causing the average queue wait time to increase for NameNode operations. The threshold values are in milliseconds.

alertDefinitions.name: namenode_last_checkpoint
alertDefinitions.label: NameNode Last Checkpoint

parameters.name: connection.timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time before this alert is considered to be CRITICAL

parameters.name: checkpoint.time.warning.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of the last checkpoint time greater than the interval in order to trigger a warning alert.

parameters.name: checkpoint.time.critical.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of the last checkpoint time greater than the interval in order to trigger a critical alert.

parameters.name: checkpoint.txns.multiplier.warning.threshold
parameters.description: The multiplier to use against dfs.namenode.checkpoint.period compared to the difference between last transaction id and most recent transaction id beyond which to trigger a warning alert.

parameters.name: checkpoint.txns.multiplier.critical.threshold
parameters.description: The multiplier to use against dfs.namenode.checkpoint.period compared to the difference between last transaction id and most recent transaction id beyond which to trigger a critical alert.

alertDefinitions.description: This service-level alert will trigger if the last time that the NameNode performed a checkpoint was too long ago. It will also trigger if the number of uncommitted transactions is beyond a certain threshold.

alertDefinitions.label: NameNode Heap Usage (Daily)

parameters.name: appId

parameters.name: metricName
parameters.description: The metric to monitor.

parameters.name: metric.deviation.warning.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of NameNode heap usage growth.

parameters.name: metric.deviation.critical.threshold
parameters.description: The percentage of NameNode heap usage growth.

parameters.name: metric.units

parameters.description: The minimum heap increase in a day.

alertDefinitions.name: kafka_broker_process
alertDefinitions.label: Kafka Broker Process
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the Kafka Broker cannot be determined to be up.

alertDefinitions.name: ams_metrics_monitor_process
alertDefinitions.label: Metrics Monitor Status
alertDefinitions.description: This alert indicates the status of the Metrics Monitor process as determined by the monitor status script.

alertDefinitions.name: ams_metrics_collector_process
alertDefinitions.label: Metrics Collector Process
alertDefinitions.description: This alert is triggered if the Metrics Collector cannot be confirmed to be up and listening on the configured port for number of seconds equal to threshold.

alertDefinitions.name: ams_metrics_collector_hbase_master_process
alertDefinitions.label: Metrics Collector - HBase Master Process
alertDefinitions.description: This alert is triggered if the Metrics Collector's HBase master processes cannot be confirmed to be up and listening on the network for the configured critical threshold, given in seconds.

alertDefinitions.name: ams_metrics_collector_hbase_master_cpu
alertDefinitions.label: Metrics Collector - HBase Master CPU Utilization
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if CPU utilization of the Metrics Collector's HBase Master exceeds certain warning and critical thresholds. It checks the HBase Master JMX Servlet for the SystemCPULoad property. The threshold values are in percent.

alertDefinitions.name: metrics_monitor_process_percent
alertDefinitions.label: Percent Metrics Monitors Available
alertDefinitions.description: This alert is triggered if a percentage of Metrics Monitor processes are not up and listening on the network for the configured warning and critical thresholds.

alertDefinitions.name: ams_metrics_collector_autostart
alertDefinitions.label: Metrics Collector - Auto-Restart Status

warning.text: Metrics Collector has been auto-started {1} times{0}.

ok.text: Metrics Collector has not been auto-started and is running normally{0}.

critical.text: Metrics Collector has been auto-started {1} times{0}.

alertDefinitions.description: This alert is triggered if the Metrics Collector has been restarted automatically too frequently in last one hour. By default, a Warning alert is triggered if restarted twice in one hour and a Critical alert is triggered if restarted 4 or more times in one hour.

alertDefinitions.name: ranger_admin_process
alertDefinitions.label: Ranger Admin Process
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the Ranger Admin Web UI is unreachable.

alertDefinitions.name: ranger_admin_password_check
alertDefinitions.label: Ranger Admin password check
alertDefinitions.description: This alert is used to ensure that the Ranger Admin password in Ambari is correct.

alertDefinitions.name: ranger_usersync_process
alertDefinitions.label: Ranger Usersync Process
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the Ranger Usersync cannot be determined to be up.

alertDefinitions.name: hive_metastore_process
alertDefinitions.label: Hive Metastore Process

parameters.name: check.command.timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time before check command will be killed by timeout

parameters.name: default.smoke.user
parameters.description: The user that will run the Hive commands if not specified in cluster-env/smokeuser

parameters.name: default.smoke.principal
parameters.description: The principal to use when retrieving the kerberos ticket if not specified in cluster-env/smokeuser_principal_name

parameters.name: default.smoke.keytab
parameters.description: The keytab to use when retrieving the kerberos ticket if not specified in cluster-env/smokeuser_keytab

alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the Hive Metastore process cannot be determined to be up and listening on the network.

alertDefinitions.name: hive_webhcat_server_status
alertDefinitions.label: WebHCat Server Status

parameters.name: default.smoke.user
parameters.description: The user that will run the Hive commands if not specified in cluster-env/smokeuser

parameters.name: connection.timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time before this alert is considered to be CRITICAL

alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the templeton server status is not healthy.

alertDefinitions.name: ambari_agent_version_select
alertDefinitions.label: Ambari Agent Distro/Conf Select Versions
alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the distro selector such as hdp-select cannot calculate versions available on this host. This may indicate that /usr/$stack/ directory has links/dirs that do not belong inside of it.

alertDefinitions.name: ambari_agent_disk_usage
alertDefinitions.label: Host Disk Usage

parameters.name: minimum.free.space
parameters.description: The overall amount of free disk space left before an alert is triggered.

parameters.name: percent.used.space.warning.threshold
parameters.description: The percent of disk space consumed before a warning is triggered.

parameters.name: percent.free.space.critical.threshold
parameters.description: The percent of disk space consumed before a critical alert is triggered.

alertDefinitions.description: This host-level alert is triggered if the amount of disk space used goes above specific thresholds. The default threshold values are 50% for WARNING and 80% for CRITICAL.
